channel.title: Can't start clients
channel.description:
Whenever I try to start clients for other people's servers, it nerver works. I open the command prompt and type the exact location of the run.bat and it says "The system cannot find the path specified." It's not the client as I have tried multiple clients that work fine for others.
I have the newest version of Java and I'm running on Windows Vista. All help is greatly appreciated.

item.title: Can't start clients
item.dc:creator: @Get_Ic3d Get Ic3d
item.description:
@Get_Ic3d wrote:

For some reason when I double click the file, my computer doesn’t recognize it as running with the command prompt. When I do ‘open with’ command prompt, a blank command prompt just pops up. I’ve got no idea why it does this, but the only way I can run .bat files is by entering the location. I can run them fine on my other computer, but I prefer to use this one (the other one is soooo slow).[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 17, 2008, 06:48:55 PM[/size][hr]Anybody else got possible solutions? I’m getting desperate. :mad:

Read full topic

item.title: Can't start clients
item.dc:creator: @kid2kewl2bereal kid2kewl2bereal
item.description:
@kid2kewl2bereal wrote:

have you tried not going to the command prompt and going straight to the file and double clicking to open from there…? it came to mind sence u said u went to command prompt thingy majigo and typed in exact name, but im guesing you have done that already. if not, just go 2 the file directly and double click

Read full topic

item.title: Can't start clients
item.dc:creator: @Get_Ic3d Get Ic3d
item.description:
@Get_Ic3d wrote:

I already have winrar. Thanks for trying to help though. Does anybody else know any possible problems? I’m willing to try anything.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't start clients
item.dc:creator: @kid2kewl2bereal kid2kewl2bereal
item.description:
@kid2kewl2bereal wrote:

do you have winrar? if not you can download it at RARlab.com and look on the left side and find ‘downloads’ and click the first download on there… then to the main part, if the icon for the client is like 3 books stacked… then WEWT i think i figured out ur problem… right click on the client icon and find 'extract to (client name or file name) and click on it… somthingshould pop up and automaticly start extracting this should only take about 3-8 seconds… after that open the folder it gives you and look through it to find ‘run’ or ‘(client name)’ somthing like that… and you should be able to get on if this dosnt work… sorry maybe i was thinking of the wrong thing and i thought u hd a diferent problem :\ but i tried

Read full topic

item.title: Can't start clients
item.dc:creator: @Get_Ic3d Get Ic3d
item.description:
@Get_Ic3d wrote:

Ok, I’ll try. Thanks for the help. I’ll get back to you in a couple of minutes.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 17, 2008, 04:16:45 PM[/size][hr]No, it still doesn’t work. I tried each of those with 2 different clients.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't start clients
item.dc:creator: @Get_Forgotten Get_Forgotten
item.description:
@Get_Forgotten wrote:

i dont know if this is going to help

these are two different client runners

@ECHO OFF title Run. color 0f java -Xmx1000m client highmem pause

@ECHO OFF TITLE NAMEREMOVED JAVA -Xmx500m EGUI PAUSE

Read full topic

item.title: Can't start clients
item.dc:creator: @Get_Ic3d Get Ic3d
item.description:
@Get_Ic3d wrote:

variable name:classpath
value:CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

variable name:path
value:C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;

Read full topic

or your path might be wrong… show me the path you have set right now…
